result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

AMENDED 12-21-2018:  Received documentation from DOC that defendant paid court obligations in full.
Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2014CF30.

Probation & Parole Agent, Michael Pribnow appears by phone. Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf not present in court. He was informed to be here by his agent Mr. Pribnow in additional he was given notice of this hearing on 11/4/18, he fails to appear, a warrant we will issue for his arrest.  In addition he owes CO obs of $518 and if he does not paid those by 12/21 he will be ordered to report to jail for 5 days as conditional jail time for failure to pay, report on 12/22 at 6 p.m.
Probation review hearing on November 26, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel confirms rec'd PSI & reviewed with client.  Recommendation by counsel.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 5 yrs. probation on count 1, 3 yrs on other count, w/conditions.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of count 1 of 14CF30/max penalties and advises of count 1 in 15CF07/max. penalties; advises defendant of his constitutional rights, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 in 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07.    Plea colloquy. Judge again advises defendant of his rights; court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas in Count 1 of 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07 and finds defendant guilty.  DRI counts 2-8 in 14CF30, DRI 15CM25, DRI 15TR38, 15TR97, Order PSI.  Trial cancelled.  Any conditions of bond are continued.  See scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to resolution, suggest 1 more status conference.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Status conference at 11-16-2015 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-07-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and constitutional rights.  NGP entered.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to P.H.  Court finds waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily and binds defendant over for trial.  State to file an Information.  Counsel to set this matter for arraignment.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Was set for motion hearing in 14CF30, no motion filed.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
